item.title: Programming Language Proficiency
item.author: joewhiteheadm@gmail.com
item.description:
Measuring programming language proficiency

Whilst reading Ultralearning by Scott H. Young I began thinking about how we learn programming languages.

My language project right now is to learn Go (this site is built on Hugo, a Go static site framework!) to the point where I can program fairly complex software & services in it, ideally to the level I can use Python. When learning anything, the first hurdle becomes direction - where do I go and when to maximise my learning whilst minimising the roadblocks, frustrations, and confusion that comes with big learning curve leaps or non-linear learning paths. If you’re lost, you’re not learning.
